content: Grassroots and self-advocacy are pillars of The Arc Minnesota’s public policy work, and our goal is to help people with disabilities, their family members, and allies feel informed and empowered to lead policy, social, and systems change. The resources in our Advocacy Toolkit are built to ignite our network of advocates as they build power and mobilize for positive social change. With questions or for more information about ways to engage in legislative advocacy with The Arc Minnesota, contact Public Policy Director Tina Rucci at tinarucci@arcminnesota.org . Who Represents Me? Find Your Elected Officials Learn how to find and connect with the elected officials that make funding and policy decisions that impact your life. Guide to Finding Who Represents You Meeting with Elected Officials Learn how to set up and have a successful meeting with an elected official. Tips for Meeting with Elected Officials Write Letters or Emails to Elected Officials Get information about sending a

html_metadata.title: Advocacy Toolkit
html_metadata.text: Grassroots and self-advocacy are pillars of The Arc Minnesota’s public policy work, and our goal is to help people with disabilities, their family members, and allies feel informed and empowered to lead policy, social, and systems change. The resources in our Advocacy Toolkit are built to ignite our network of advocates as they build power and mobilize for positive social change. With questions or for more information about ways to engage in legislative advocacy with The Arc Minnesota, contact Public Policy Director Tina Rucci at tinarucci@arcminnesota.org . Who Represents Me? Find Your Elected Officials Learn how to find and connect with the elected officials that make funding and policy decisions that impact your life. Guide to Finding Who Represents You Meeting with Elected Officials Learn how to set up and have a successful meeting with an elected official. Tips for Meeting with Elected Officials Write Letters or Emails to Elected Officials Get information about sending a letter/email to your elected official. Template included. How to Write Letters or Emails to Elected Officials Share Your Story One of the best ways to create change is through sharing a personal story with your elected officials. Learn how to with this resource. Share Your Story Create Your Story Learn how to explain your story to elected officials. Create Your Story Plan Your Story Use this template to plan out your story to communicate to elected officials. Plan Your Story Policy Words to Know Prepare for your meeting with learning some of the common words used when talking about policy. Policy Words to Know Guide to Home Visits Home visits are an important tool to help build relationships with elected officials, and a supportive network of persons with disabilities and their families who want to share their stories. Guide to Home Visits Sharing Your Story Resources By sharing a story about personal successes and challenges, people with disabilities and their families can help elected officials understand how their decisions about policy and funding affect us. Sharing Your Story Subscribe to the Capitol Connector The Capitol Connector is The Arc Minnesota's public policy newsletter. It is released every other week. Get the Capitol Connector
